purpleculture_pinyin:
wū
to accuse falsely
ложно обвинить
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 诬)
Ideographic: To start 言 a witch-hunt 巫; 巫 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
誣衊 [ wū miè ]: to slander; to smear; to vilify
誣陷 [ wū xiàn ]: to entrap; to frame; to plant false evidence against sb
誣告 [ wū gào ]: to frame sb; to accuse falsely
誣賴 [ wū lài ]: to accuse falsely
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 巫 [ wū ] wizard, sorcerer, witch, shaman
heisig_chinese_memo: During the Salem witch trials many people were charged falsely with words accusing them of being witches.
Ru_trainchinese: wū: (глаг) клеветать, без вины обвинять
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In the salem trials people would charge falsely other people for being witches just because they said a few words which were out of the ordinary.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " words " and " witch ", the original meaning is false words. "Shuowen": "Jiaye. Congyan, the sound of witchcraft." "Shu‧Zhongyuzhizhi": "The King Xia is guilty. He is guilty of falsehood, and he uses his life to lay down his life." Kong Chuan: To abuse the people."

" Fraud " can mean slander and framing. "Mandarin ‧ Zhou Yuxia": "Today's Quebec's language is guilty, Shuyu, Jifa, guilty is Lingren, yuu is slander, and guilty is concealed."

" False " also means boasting and boasting. "Guan Zi‧ Riding Horse": "The monarch does things, and the ministers dare not slander what he cannot.

" Fake " also means deception. "The Fourteenth Year of Zuo Zhuan-Xiang Gong": "The Minister Zhuzong died and was not guilty. Jiang said: "If there is no god, why tell? If there is, don't lie!"

" Fraud " also means falsehood and falsehood. The Northern Qi Yanzhi's "Family Precepts of the Yan Family: Health Care": "The matter of the gods cannot be completely false."

" Fake " also means distortion. "The Analects of Confucius-Zizhang": "How can a gentleman be falsely accused? There is a sage who has a beginning and a death!"

" Fraud " also refers to obliteration. Southern Song Dynasty Liu Yiqing "Shishuo Xinyu·Literature": "Jian Wenyun: "You can reach the peak without knowing it? But Tao Lian's merits cannot be blamed.""
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " words " and " witch ", the original meaning is nonsense.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「巫」聲，本義為妄言。《說文》：「加也。从言，巫聲。」 《書‧仲虺之誥》：「夏王有罪，矯誣上天，以布命于下。」孔傳：「言託天以行虐於民。」

　　「誣」可表示誣衊、誣陷。《國語‧周語下》：「今郤伯之語犯，叔迂，季伐，犯則陵人，迂則誣人，伐則掩人。」

　　「誣」也表示誇說、吹噓。《管子‧乘馬》：「君舉事，臣不敢誣其所不能。」

　　「誣」也表示欺騙。《左傳‧襄公十四年》：「公使祝宗告亡，且告無罪。定姜曰：『無神，何告？若有，不可誣也！』」杜預注：「誣，欺也。」

　　「誣」還表示虛假、虛妄。北齊顏之推《顏氏家訓‧養生》：「神仙之事，未可全誣。」

　　「誣」亦表示歪曲。《論語‧子張》：「君子之道，焉可誣也？有始有卒者，其惟聖人乎！」

　　「誣」也指抹煞。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧文學》：「簡文云：『不知便可登峰造極不？然陶練之功尚不可誣。』」

誣陷 [ wū xiàn ]: to entrap; to frame; to plant false evidence against sb

Chinese: During the Salem witch trials many people were charged falsely with words accusing them of being witches.
Meaning: charge falsely
Hanzi: 诬
Story: In the salem trials people would charge falsely other people for being witches just because they said a few words which were out of the ordinary.
Kind: traditional

從「 言 」，「 巫 」聲，本義為妄言。《說文》：「加也。从言，巫聲。」 《書‧仲虺之誥》：「夏王有罪，矯誣上天，以布命于下。」孔傳：「言託天以行虐於民。」 「 誣 」可表示誣衊、誣陷。《國語‧周語下》：「今郤伯之語犯，叔迂，季伐，犯則陵人，迂則誣人，伐則掩人。」 「 誣 」也表示誇說、吹噓。《管子‧乘馬》：「君舉事，臣不敢誣其所不能。」 「 誣 」也表示欺騙。《左傳‧襄公十四年》：「公使祝宗告亡，且告無罪。定姜曰：『無神，何告？若有，不可誣也！』」杜預注：「誣，欺也。」 「 誣 」還表示虛假、虛妄。北齊顏之推《顏氏家訓‧養生》：「神仙之事，未可全誣。」 「 誣 」亦表示歪曲。《論語‧子張》：「君子之道，焉可誣也？有始有卒者，其惟聖人乎！」 「 誣 」也指抹煞。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧文學》：「簡文云：『不知便可登峰造極不？然陶練之功尚不可誣。』」

He is guilty of falsehood, and he uses his life to lay down his life." Kong Chuan: To abuse the people." " Fraud" can mean slander and framing. "Guan Zi‧ Riding Horse": "The monarch does things, and the ministers dare not slander what he cannot. " Fake" also means deception. "The Fourteenth Year of Zuo Zhuan-Xiang Gong": "The Minister Zhuzong died and was not guilty. Jiang said: "If there is no god, why tell? If there is, don't lie!" " Fraud" also means falsehood and falsehood. The Northern Qi Yanzhi's "Family Precepts of the Yan Family: Health Care": "The matter of the gods cannot be completely false." " Fake" also means distortion. "The Analects of Confucius-Zizhang": "How can a gentleman be falsely accused? There is a sage who has a beginning and a death!" " Fraud" also refers to obliteration. 誣字的基本解释

誣
wū
见“诬”。

誣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wū］
［《廣韻》武夫切，平虞，微。］
“幠2”的被通假字。“诬1”的繁体字。
(1)加之以不实之辞，妄言。
(2)诬蔑；诬陷。
(3)夸说；吹嘘。
(4)欺骗。
(5)虚假；虚妄。
(6)歪曲。
(7)以有为无；抹煞。

誣字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　誣； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1163第17
【唐韻】武扶切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】微夫切，?音無。【說文】加也。【徐曰】以無爲有也。【玉篇】欺罔也。【廣韻】誣，枉也。【正韻】詐也，衊也，謗也。【易·繫辭】誣善之人其辭游。【疏】誣罔善人，其辭虛漫。【禮·表記】故其受祿不誣。【註】不信曰誣。【周語】其?矯誣。【註】加罪無辜曰誣。【荀子·大略篇】不能而居之，誣也。　又【讀書通】通作憮。【論語】君子之道焉，可誣也。【前漢·薛宣傳】引作憮。【晉灼註】憮同誣。　【篇韻】譌作誈。

誣字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
誣字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wū］
["Guangyun" Wu Fuqie, Pingyu, Wei. ]
"幠2" was passed falsely. Traditional characters for "诬1".
(1) Add false remarks and false statements.
(2) Defamation; framing.
(3) Boasting; boasting.
(4) Deception.
(5) False; false.
(6) Distortion.
(7) Regarding existence as non-existence; obliterating.
False
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[You Ji 1] [Words Department] 　謬; Kangxi strokes: 14; Page number: page 1163 to 17
[Tang Yun] Wu Fuqie [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Wei Fuqie,? No sound. [Said the text] Jia Ye. [Xu Yue] Do nothing for something. [Jade articles] Deceptively. [Guang Yun] Framing, it is in vain. [Zhengyun] Fraud, contempt, and slander. 【Yi·Xi Ci】The excerpts of the people who frame the good. [Sparse] slander the good people, and their words are vain. 【Ritual·Table Records】Therefore, he is not falsely accused. [Note] Do not believe it means falsehood. [Zhou Yu] Its? Correction. [Note] To accuse the innocent is false. 【Xunzi·A Brief Introduction】If you can't live it, you can make false accusations.　[Reading Master] It's all shocking. [The Analects] The way of a gentleman can be false. [Former Han·Xue Propaganda] Quoted as startled. [Jin Zhuo Note] The same false accusation.　【Pian Yun】譌譌譌誈.
